full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 107 of 247 235 LBUCmax3 Visoski - cross 1 A. Correct. Yes. 2 Q. Mr. Visoski, I think you were asked as part of your employment to sign a nondisclosure agreement? 3 A. That is correct. 4 Q. Now, when you were asked to sign a nondisclosure agreement, you didn't think it was unusual, did you? 5 A. Not at all. 6 Q. And you certainly didn't take it to mean that you needed to sign it so you wouldn't disclose some kind of illegal activity that was happening on the plane, did you? 7 A. No, of course not. 8 Q. You never saw anything that came close to that; right? 9 A. Correct. 10 Q. You just took it to mean you couldn't write a book about the stuff and the people you were interacting with; right? 11 A. That's correct. Several of my colleagues have signed the same or similar documents in my profession. It's a fairly normal request. 12 Q. So for people who fly private jets, this is a fairly common occurrence? 13 A. That is correct, sure. 14 Q. You have a lot of people, high profile people we just mentioned, who don't want necessarily all their business written about in a book; right? 15 A. Exactly. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00011879

You have a lot of people, high profile people we just mentioned, who don't want necessarily all their business written about in a book; right? 15 A. Exactly.
